sentences.en: All the organisms in an ecosystem are part of an evolutionary continuum.
sentences.cn: 生态系统中的所有生物都是进化连续体的一个环节。

sentences.en: At the other end of the continuum is the small - t personality.
sentences.cn: 在统一体的另一端则是小t性格者.

sentences.en: Continuum percolation theory and Archie's law.
sentences.cn: 连续区渗透理论和Archie's定律.

sentences.en: Could training be a straight - line continuum?
sentences.cn: 它可以是一条连续的直线 吗 ?

sentences.en: It is at one end of the cost continuum.
sentences.cn: 这位于成本序列的一端。

sentences.en: Keep in mind as you read through this section that sexualitya continuum.
sentences.cn: 通过这一段的阅读你应该记住一点那就是性病是一系列症状的综合体.

sentences.en: Spatial continuum inside the architecture represents a strong feeling of mobility.
sentences.cn: 管中设有坡道、楼梯、电梯与自动扶梯,使得游人可选择不同的路径,参观、交流、休息.

sentences.en: Statistical analyses respect the full continuum.
sentences.cn: 统计分析显示众人得分分布在整条线上.

sentences.en: Suspicion and knowledge are poles apart on a continuum of understanding.
sentences.cn: 怀疑和知悉在理解的统一体上是截然相反的.

sentences.en: The angular part of a continuum wave function is, of course, a spherical harmonic.
sentences.cn: 连续谱波函数的角度部分当然是球谐函数.

sentences.en: The continuum of the corona is essentially radially polarized.
sentences.cn: 日冕连续区基本上是经向偏振.

sentences.en: The Creole language is really various dialects arranged on a continuum.
sentences.cn: 克里奥 耳语其实是多种方言的一个统一体。

sentences.en: The fact is that language varieties exist along a continuum.
sentences.cn: 实际上语言的变化是连续的.

sentences.en: The medical professional bodies reply that development from fertilisation onwards is a continuum.
sentences.cn: 专业医疗机构答复说受精以后的发育是连续的。

sentences.en: The polarizable continuum model is applied in the calculations in solution.
sentences.cn: 溶液中的计算采用可极化连续介质模型.

sentences.en: These various complaints are part of a continuum of ill-health.
sentences.cn: 这些各种各样的疾病、不适都是身体健康状况欠佳的一种表现。

sentences.en: You cannot separate one part of history from the continuum.

words.tran_cn: 连续的，持续的；继续的；连绵不断的
连续性；一连串；分镜头剧本

trans.tran_cn: [数]连续统，[经]连续统一体，闭联集，[物]连续区
trans.tran_en: a scale of related things on which each one is only slightly different from the one before
